summary: Task app: quick-add from side menu should create tasks without requiring a project, default date to today, and remain fast/effective; users can assign a project and change date later.
architectural_notes: Quick-add task flow (side menu) must not require project assignment; tasks default to no project and date=today, with later edits allowed.

existing_features.title: Change the side-menu quick-add flow in the task drawer (frontend/src/components/TaskDrawer.tsx) so it does not require any projects to exist, does not auto-assign a default project, and creates the task with due date set to today by default.

Ensure users can assign a project later for an unassigned task via existing task editing UI, by wiring the project selector to the backend API that updates a taskâ€™s project (so selecting a project actually persists).

new_feature_requests.summary: Update side-menu quick add: project not mandatory (default none), set task date to today, keep creation fast; allow later project/date edits
Update the backend Task model and APIs to support tasks with no project assigned (unassigned tasks), while preserving existing ownership/permission checks and allowing a project to be assigned later.

Add a conditional Motoko migration (backend/migration.mo) to safely upgrade existing deployed state to the updated Task model that supports unassigned tasks (ensuring existing tasks retain their current project assignment).

projectName: Make side-menu quick-add create tasks without a project and default due date to today
